name: Panel: Future of Small Publishing | Indie Ink 2025
description:
“The Future of Small & Independent Publishing” – a conversation on the evolving landscape of indie publishing, the role of community, and the possibilities that lie ahead.

Panelists:
Nikhil Ravichandar, LURU Magazine
Mohit Mahato, Pagal Canvas

When: September 27, Saturday, 12 PM
Where: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar

Free entry! Registration must.

name: Workshop: Zine-making & Reading
description:
Zine Workshop + Reading with Nikhil Poddar 

Join us for an evening of storytelling, zine-making, and conversation with Nikhil Poddar as he conducts a Storytelling for Zines Workshop and does a live reading of his zine Akela.

Learn how to turn ideas into zines, experiment with narrative formats, and hear Akela come alive. Spots are limited — register now

name: Tell Me Love: Zine Reading & Creative Walkthrough
description:
tell me love: on lost friendships, grief, and zine-making
~ an intimate reading + creative walkthrough
Friendship breakups are beasts of grief, yet we are rarely given rituals or tools to feel through them. In this session, writer and zine-maker Soumya John shares the creative process behind tell me love, her zine of poems born from old email exchanges with a lost friend.
Through letter-writing, collage, and poetry, this zine transforms nostalgia and grief into beauty and meaning. Part reading, part storytelling, and part art therapy, Soumya invites you to witness how zine-making can be a sacred creative practice of remembrance, tenderness, and healing.
When: September 26, Friday, 6:15 PM
Where: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar, Bengaluru

name: Collaborative Zines Workshop
description:
Zine artist Preston Olakatu will guide participants through the process of making a collaborative zine from scratch. Together, we’ll explore how individual ideas and artistic styles can come together to form a single, cohesive publication.

Expect a mix of brainstorming, quick doodling, collage-making, and storytelling exercises that allow every participant to contribute their unique voice. This workshop is a playful, hands-on way to connect with others, experiment with self-expression, and walk away with a one-of-a-kind collective zine created by the group.

🗓 26 September, Friday, 5:00 PM
📌 Atta Galatta, Indiranagar 

Free, registration mandatory! 

No prior experience is required — just bring your curiosity, creativity, and willingness to collaborate!

name: Panel: Why Zines Matter | Indie Ink 2025
description:
“From Punk to Perzines: Why Zines Matter Today” – a conversation on the role of zines in amplifying voices, building communities, and pushing the boundaries of independent publishing.

Panelists:
Soundarya Gottapu, Zine Artist
Jyotsna Ramesh, Zine Artist

When: September 28, Sunday, 12 PM
Where: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
Free entry! Registration must.

name: Soka Sunday Ritualt ft Sando Club
description: Sando Club, Bangalore brings to Soka their mouth watering famous sandos for 1 afternoon. Here's your chance to try their sandos if you've haven't before,  along with some brunch special Soka cocktails.

name: Cake Painting Workshop
description: Join this unique Cake Painting Workshop at Eywa Café. Learn how to turn your cake into a beautiful canvas using edible buttercream paints. Whether you’re a beginner or a baking enthusiast, this hands-on session promises fun, flavour, and artistry, with a cake you can proudly take home

name: Stories of Women's World Cups in India
description:
Calling all sports history nerds! In 2017, India’s women cricketers came heartbreakingly close to a World Cup win at Lord’s. That match lit a fire, changing how the country saw its women athletes, and laying the foundation for today’s Women’s Premier League – the first women’s sports league to turn profitable even before a single ball was bowled.

It’s the first time since that iconic evening at Lord’s that the Women’s World Cup is set to be hosted in India.

This session will celebrate those forgotten days when world cups in India were played in front of empty seats, even when the cricket itself was no less significant. Bringing these narratives to life are some of the best storytellers on women's cricket: Karunya Keshav (Editor, Sportswriter & Advocate for Women in Sport), Ananya Upendran (Writer & Former Cricketer), and Aayush Puthran (Author & Journalist).

Hosted in collaboration with Bookmark - a dating app for readers. Created by the founders of Cubbon Reads, Bookmark is an app where one swipes books, not looks. Through a virtual bookshelf and prompts, people can find book buddies across the world.

This is a conversation that’s never been attempted on a stage globally, so far. RSVP on BIC website: https://bangaloreinternationalcentre.org/event/played-and-missed/

name: Retro Gaming console workshop
description:
👾 Gamers + Makers, this is for you!
What if you could design, solder, and build your own handheld gaming console – and then power it up to play Super Mario, Pokémon, Contra, and other NES classics?

At the DIY Retro Gaming Console Workshop, we’re combining electronics, creativity, and nostalgia into one unforgettable experience.

You will learn:
• Designing & debugging electronic circuits
• PCB fabrication basics
• Soldering & assembling components
• Using tools with hands-on guidance
• Mentorship from passionate makers

🎮 And the best part?
You’ll walk away with a fully functional retro gaming console that runs Nintendo classics!

Limited seats! Secure your spot today

name: Heart Lamp Interactive Workshop | Freedom, Stories, Art & Reflection
description:
Some books stay with you long after you’ve turned the last page. Heart Lamp, the International Booker Prize–winning anthology by Banu Mushtaq, is one of those rare works. It makes you think and it makes you feel—drawing you into the lived experiences of Indian Muslim women, while also inviting you to reflect on your own world.
This October, we’re bringing Heart Lamp off the page and into our lives with an interactive workshop on the idea of freedom at our Indiranagar store. 
But this isn’t your usual book discussion. Instead, we’ll explore three of the anthology’s most powerful stories through music, art, and storytelling. It’s a chance to step away from screens, share perspectives, and spend a Sunday morning in meaningful conversation with fellow readers. No prior prep is needed—just pick up your copy of Heart Lamp at Champaca before the workshop.

name: Dans Punk feat. Gavsborg
description:
GAVSBORG MAKES HIS INDIA DEBUT

Join us for a special edition as explore sounds of Dub and Dancehall on an incredible Function-One Sound System. 

In a city where DJs and dance crews already love their dancehall sounds, we wanted to bring someone fresh—Founder of Equiknoxx and one of the most adventurous producers and DJs from Kingston, Jamaica—Gavsborg. A key force behind reshaping the language of dancehall, he pushes it into fractured, futuristic forms without losing the pulse of Kingston’s streets. One of the most versatile and adventurous DJ’s his sets will glide through sounds of dub, dancehall, footwork, jungle, zouk, soca in way that is uniquely his. 

Joining him on the night: Read The Room creative head Kaydi b2b FGR’s Nich, and Bangalore’s own Sura—a lineup built to push the room into new shapes and trace how dub has influenced a range of genres. 

Share this with your friends,fam and lovers! Its going to be a wicked one. 

Focus Group Radio is committed to building experiences that are inclusive for women, non-binary, transgender and queer folks. We’re taking additional efforts to ensure attendees at our gig feel safe and free to enjoy the music.

name: Chai Time - Japan Style
description:
Not your usual chai break 👀
Here, you whisk your own matcha, sip it slow, and vibe with chewy-soft mochi that’s almost too cute to eat. 🌸
Write your secret wishes on our dreamy Japanese Wishing Tree (manifest + aesthetic ✨) and let the calm, soulful vibes take over.
It’s chai time… but with a Japanese twist. Calm, fun & totally Instagrammable 💚

name: Chai Time - Japan Style
description:
Chai Time – Japan Style 🌿🍵✨
Not your usual chai break 👀
Here, you whisk your own matcha, sip it slow, and vibe with chewy-soft mochi that’s almost too cute to eat. 🌸
Write your secret wishes on our dreamy Japanese Wishing Tree (manifest + aesthetic ✨) and let the calm, soulful vibes take over.
It’s chai time… but with a Japanese twist. Calm, fun & totally Instagrammable 💚

name: Love in the Time of Algorithms by The Self Centre
description:
Experience an intimate theatrical journey through modern romance with five compelling vignettes. From awkward first dates to long-term relationship crossroads, witness authentic moments of connection, heartbreak, hope, and discovery. These slice-of-life stories capture the beautiful complexity of dating and relationships in contemporary life.
Who is The Self Centre?

Self Centre is a space dedicated to exploring the self and dilemmas of our times through theatre. We create and curate work that responds to the pulse of the community, offering space for reflection, dialogue, and transformation. Our approach—what we call transformational theatre—is rooted in the belief that performance can shift not only perspectives, but also possibilities for how we live and relate to one another.

You can follow them on Instagram at @selfcentre.in

name: Maestro Impro™️ by Improv Lore
description:
Maestro Impro™️ is a beloved world-famous competitive elimination-style improv format that pits twelve brave improvisers against each other. They’ll take on scenes, games, and challenges from the audience to build never-before seen/heard stories.

After each round, the audience gets to vote improvisers out until just one remains to claim all the improv glory and be crowned the Maestro for the month!
Who are Improv Lore?

We are Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, works towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.

name: PowerPoint Roulette by Improv Lore
description:
PowerPoint Roulette is a fast-paced, creative show where improvisers deliver presentations from slides they’ve never seen before. Each performer is faced with slides filled with bizarre graphs, meaningless acronyms, and unexpected themes. With no time to prepare, they must improvise convincing explanations, facts, stories, and insights on the spot.

Serious business pitches, heartfelt eulogies, hard-hitting TED talks, and fanciful conspiracy theories - prepare yourselves for a night ‘official’ fun! The audience gets to join the revelry by asking questions, creating a truly unpredictable night of improvised theatrics.

Who are Improv Lore?

We are a Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, working towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.

name: Hands-On Art: A Tactile Journey Through the MAP Collection
description:
Join Gurjeet Singh for a unique sensory journey through Visible/Invisible: Representations of Women in Art through the MAP Collection.

Designed for people with visual impairment, this tactile workshop invites participants to explore artworks through touch, then channel their experience into creating personal tactile artworks exploring ornamentation and self-expression. All workshop materials, from textile fragments to modeling tools and decorative elements, are included.

Please note: This workshop is specifically designed for people with visual disabilities. Participants are welcome to bring a friend or family member to join them.

location.name: Museum of Art & Photography (MAP), Ashok Nagar
location.address: Museum of Art & Photography (MAP), Ashok Nagar, Bangalore

name: Y2K REWIND
description:
Come Dressed as a Musical Memory from the 2000s! Transform yourself into a moment when music moved you. Channel the iconic imagery of a beloved album cover, embody the colorful energy of a Bollywood dance number, or bring to life that unforgettable childhood jingle that still plays in your head. We want to see how personal musical connections inspire your creative expression.
 
Join us as we unveil Pulse Vol 5: Soundscapes—our latest exploration into how sound, music, and silence weave through our lives and identities. This captivating issue features diverse voices expressing their sonic experiences through short films, poetry, photography, and more.

location.name: Museum of Art and Photography, Ashok Nagar
location.address: Museum of Art and Photography, Ashok Nagar, Bangalore

name: The Art Of Flight
description:
In this 90-minute deep dive into arm balances, we’ll move beyond the surface and into the strength, structure, and spirit of the poses that make us feel like we're flying.

We’ll begin by warming up the body with targeted strength and mobility drills to activate the core, wrists, and shoulders. This lays the foundation for safe and sustainable arm balancing.
From there, we’ll explore essential alignment principles that demystify key transitions and make these seemingly impossible shapes, more accessible.
Through clear breakdowns and playful experimentation, you’ll learn how to “take off” with confidence—whether you’re working on Crow, Side Crow, Hustler’s or Peacock pose.
We’ll also cover how to fall safely, so fear doesn’t hold you back, and give space for mindful repetition, skill refinement, and personal breakthroughs.
Expect a blend of technique, mindset coaching, and drills, all aimed at helping you tap into your inner strength and elevate your practice.

Whether you're just starting to hover or need refining in arm balances; this is a safe space for you to practice and learn.

name: NOT-SO-KLASSIC (Veg)
description:
At Klaa, we’re always celebrating the roots but sometimes, we like to bend the rules.
Not So Klassic is our playful new series where we reimagine Goan flavours through a different lens: layered, experimental, and just a little bit cheeky.

Think familiar ingredients doing unfamiliar things, flavours that surprise you, and plates that tell a new kind of story. Each menu is a limited-edition tasting experience paired with thoughtfully chosen wines to match the mood.

This isn’t your typical Goan thali.
It’s Not So Klassic and we hope you’re as excited to taste it as we are to cook it.

name: NOT-SO-KLASSIC (Non-veg)
description:
At Klaa, we’re always celebrating the roots but sometimes, we like to bend the rules.
Not So Klassic is our playful new series where we reimagine Goan flavours through a different lens: layered, experimental, and just a little bit cheeky.

Think familiar ingredients doing unfamiliar things, flavours that surprise you, and plates that tell a new kind of story. Each menu is a limited-edition tasting experience paired with thoughtfully chosen wines to match the mood.

This isn’t your typical Goan thali.
It’s Not So Klassic and we hope you’re as excited to taste it as we are to cook it.

name: Pint of View (Lecture 5): Fly Me To The Moon
description:
Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.

In our fifth lecture, we’re bringing you Jatan Mehta, a space writer, journalist and author of Moon Monday, the world’s only blog & newsletter dedicated to covering lunar exploration by countries worldwide. He also writes Indian Space Progress, a monthly report on our country’s increasingly relevant space capabilities in the global arena.

Jatan will take us on a journey through humankind’s fascination with our closest celestial neighbour, the Moon. At long last, we are returning humans to the moon! China is aiming to land people on our cosmic companion by 2030, and the US wants to beat them. India is preparing to bring lunar samples. But why has it taken so long to get back to our moon? What sets it apart from Mars and the rest of the Solar System? Come, join us to get answers to these key questions at our lecture: Fly Me To The Moon (From Apollo to Chandrayaan: A Dive into the History & Future of Lunar Exploration).

All of this, over Geist beer on tap at Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar! 🍻

What to Expect:

• A 60-minute lecture on the history and future of lunar exploration
• 15–20 minutes of interactive Q&A
• One Geist beer on tap or a mocktail included with your ticket
• A lively mixer to share your insights and learnings and take home a new perspective

Event Details:

📅 Sunday, 28th September | 4 PM – 6 PM
📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar
🎫 Limited to 60 attendees only

About the Lecturer

Jatan Mehta is a globally published space writer and journalist. He authors Moon Monday, the world’s only blog & newsletter dedicated to covering lunar exploration by countries worldwide. Jatan also writes Indian Space Progress, a monthly report on our country’s increasingly relevant space capabilities in the global arena. His space blog can be found at https://jatan.space

About Pint of View

Inspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., Pint of View brings this format to India for the first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand, walking out with a new way of seeing the world.

Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

name: Lasercut Loom Weaving Workshop!
description:
In this hands-on workshop, you’ll explore the intersection of digital fabrication and traditional craft. We’ll begin by customizing and laser cutting a small weaving loom (approx. 100 × 70 mm), with the option to personalize it through custom engraving. 
Once your loom is ready, you’ll learn the fundamentals of weaving—how to set up the warp, weave different patterns, and experiment with textures and colors. By the end, you’ll take home your own custom laser cut loom along with your woven creation, and the skills to continue weaving on your own. You will get to take home looms of 4 different sizes (40x50mm, 60x90mm, 65x45mm, 35x40mm), including the one you customize.
This workshop is perfect for anyone curious about laser cutting, textile art, or simply looking to try something new and tactile. No prior experience with laser cutting or weaving is required!

-Ages 14 and above.
-Please bring your own Laptops (Mac/Windows/Linux is okay)
-Contact 9845620061 for more details.

name: Silent Reading
description: Too busy to read lately? Here’s your pause button. Step away from the rush and gift yourself two quiet hours with a book and a warm cup of coffee. No deadlines, no distractions - just you, the pages, and a little peace. Bring along your own read or pick one from our shelves and let yourself sink into the story you’ve been meaning to get back to.

name: Family Movie Night at Coro: 101 Dalmations
description: Settle in for a cozy family evening with a screening of Disney’s beloved classic 101 Dalmatians. This animated tale of adventure, loyalty, and over a hundred spotted pups promises laughter and heart for kids and adults alike. With fresh popcorn on hand and a playful atmosphere, it’s the perfect chance to relax together and relive a timeless story that continues to charm across generations.

name: Christel House Tournament
description: The Christel House Tournament returns to KGA with its afternoon session, bringing golfers together in support of education and social transformation. As part of the prestigious Duke of Edinburgh Cup 2025 series, this charity tournament combines spirited competition on the greens with a larger purpose—raising funds to empower underprivileged students through Christel House’s initiatives. Players can expect a challenging round of golf, camaraderie among peers, and the opportunity to make a meaningful impact beyond the course.

location.name: Karnataka Golf Association, Golf Avenue
location.address: Karnataka Golf Association, Golf Avenue, Bangalore

name: Maha Dandiya Utsav
description: Get ready for an unforgettable celebration of culture, music, and dance as Maha Dandiya Utsav – 2nd Edition returns with even more color, energy, and excitement! sprawling open‑air lawn ground, giving you a magical outdoor setting to celebrate Navratri under the stars! Following the overwhelming success of our first edition, this year’s Dandiya Utsav promises to be bigger, brighter, and better, bringing families, friends, and communities together for a joyous Navratri celebration. Immerse yourself in the magic of traditional Garba and Dandiya Raas, vibrant ethnic attire, foot‑tapping beats, delicious festive food, and an ambiance filled with devotion and delight. Whether you’re a seasoned dancer or a first‑timer, this is the perfect place to create lifelong memories with your loved ones. Join us for this family‑friendly, cultural extravaganza that celebrates Indian traditions in their most vibrant form! Event Highlights: Live DJ and traditional Garba/Dandiya music Live Punjabi Dhol Durga Puja & Aarthi Ceremony Open dance floor for all age groups Open lawn area & Indoor Access Ethnic dress code Photo Zone Food stalls with festive delights Safe and secure environment for families Free Parking available at the venue Contactless Ticketing & Fast‑track Entry with M‑ticket. Fri 26 Sep 2025 ‑ Wed 1 Oct 2025 4:00 PM 6 Hours All age groups Kannada, Bengali, Gujarati, Marathi, Hin... Jayamahal Palace Hotel: Bengaluru ₹99 onwards (in.bookmyshow.com)

name: Finding Bangalore: No Stone Unturned
description: Listing tile text and short description describing the talk by Ramjee Chandran about Bangalore history and landmarks.

name: Kaal Netra - Sacred Matrices
description: The National Gallery of Modern Art presents Kaal Netra – Sacred Matrices: Seema Kohli’s Living Mythic Universe, an exhibition that explores spirituality, gender, and agency through Kohli’s layered visual language. Alongside the showcase, a panel discussion titled Feminist Forkings: on Gender and Agency brings together artists, scholars, and critics to reflect on how myth, memory, and the feminine body shape contemporary artistic practice. Together, the exhibition and dialogue invite audiences to engage with Kohli’s vision of mythology as a living, evolving force.

location.name: National Gallery Of Modern Art, Vasanth Nagar
location.address: National Gallery Of Modern Art, Vasanth Nagar, Bangalore

name: Dasara Dolls Display
description: Alliance Française de Bangalore hosts a Dasara Dolls Display by artist Soumya Srikanth, showcasing a rare collection of handmade dolls and heirlooms preserved for over 80 years. Blending tradition with artistry, the exhibition features intricately crafted clay dolls from Srikanth’s personal collection, highlighting her mastery in animation and clay modelling. This vibrant display offers a glimpse into cultural heritage, craftsmanship, and the enduring spirit of Dasara celebrations.

name: Dandiya Night 2025
description: Join us for a night of non‑stop energy, vibrant colors, and infectious beats at the Dandiya Night event! Experience the magic of Navratri, with traditional Garba and Dandiya Raas performances, live music, and dancing that’ll keep you moving all night long! Anchor and DJ lineups are scheduled across three electrifying evenings—on Friday, 26 September 2025, VJ Hemalatha and DJ Senleo alongside the live band Beat Gurus will set the mood; Saturday welcomes Anupama Bhat with DJ Deep Bhamra and Beat Gurus; and Sunday features Mayur Raghavendra, DJ Senleo, and Beat Gurus again—all weaving together rhythm, tradition, and live performance. The event unfolds from 6:00 PM to approximately 10:30 PM each night at the Nandi Link Grounds in Bengaluru, inviting attendees aged 3 and up to immerse themselves in the festive atmosphere across languages including Gujarati, Bengali, Kannada, and Hindi. M‑Ticket holders enjoy contactless ticketing and fast‑track entry, with tickets starting from ₹777.

location.name: Nandi Link Grounds, Pantarapalya, Nayandahalli
location.address: Nandi Link Grounds, Pantarapalya, Nayandahalli, Bangalore

name: Unnayanaa: Uncut
description: A sound that crosses borders... Unnayanaa takes over with a set that blends Afrobeat, house, Brazilian rhythms... Friday, 26th September. 9:30 PM onwards. Middle Room, Bangalore. Tickets exclusively on Swiggy Scenes.

location.name: The Middle room, Shanti Nagar
location.address: The Middle room, Shanti Nagar, Bangalore

name: The Ravi Iyer Fusion Quartet
description: The Ravi Iyer Fusion Quartet brings a dynamic world fusion sound led by acclaimed guitarist and composer Ravi Iyer. Blending Hindustani and Carnatic classical music with the textures of rock and jazz, the quartet creates original compositions that weave intricate melodies with complex rhythmic patterns. The result is an engaging, high-energy performance that bridges traditions and genres, offering audiences an inspired musical journey.

name: Postcard from Italy
description: Embark on a culinary journey through Italy with Postcards from Italy, a special dinner pairing regional Italian dishes with Grover Zampa’s premium wines. Each course is inspired by the flavors and traditions of a different Italian region, offering guests a taste of the country’s diverse food culture. With thoughtfully curated wine pairings and a menu designed to transport you across Italy, the evening promises a rich blend of flavor, memory, and storytelling on the plate.

name: Played and Missed
description: Played and Missed explores the untold stories of women’s cricket World Cups in India, focusing on the period when these events were played behind mostly empty stands—even though the games themselves were no less meaningful. The session brings together three notable storytellers: Ananya Upendran, a former Indian cricketer turned journalist and cricket scout; Karunya Keshav, an editor, writer and co‑author of the history of women’s cricket in India; and Aayush Puthran, a journalist and author who writes on cricket and sports narratives. This engaging evening will revisit the 2017 World Cup at Lords—an inflection point for women’s sport in India—and examine how that moment sparked a shift in perceptions and paved the way for the Women’s Premier League. Attendees will gain a richer understanding of how these early, often overlooked narratives laid the groundwork for today’s growth in women’s cricket. The event is free, open to all on a first‑come, first‑served basis with RSVP and availability.

name: OTJF: What They Do
description: On The Jungle Floor presents What They Do our new hip‑hop series inspired by The Roots’ classic track. Back in ’96, the song called out imitation and reminded us to never follow the herd. We’re flipping that spirit into a celebration of what hip‑hop truly does: the cipher, the record shop, the basement session, the block party… For our first edition, we’re going to dive into the frequencies that defined a generation. From hip‑hop’s golden age to neo‑soul’s lush warmth and R&B’s undeniable sway, the night is built on the grooves that shaped the culture and still echo today. What They Do is our ode to hip‑hop in its broadest sense, not just through sound, but also the feeling. This is where stories find space again and Edition 1 is just the beginning. Friday, September 26th, 2025 | 8 PM onwards 23rd Street Pizza, Castle Street, Bangalore

name: Be a Neighbourhood Naturalist: A neighbourhood walk with some fun activities
description:
You don't need a forest or a park to spot nature's magic, it's all around you! Join us for a short neighbourhood walk and hands- on activities inspired by the book Be a Neighbourhood Naturalist. 

Be a Neighbourhood Naturalist has been created by a team with decades of experience studying the natural world, and working in the field of nature conservation. Packed with creative experiments and stunning illustrations, this book will open your eyes to the magic of the natural world and the amazing living things that share your neighborhood.
